title: Ockupy Website
blurb: A website powered by ReactJS and Meteor displaying the work and services of Ockupy, a digital marketing agency with which I had the pleasure of working as a web developer intern. As part of a persistent team of two, we gave the website a responsive design overhaul and made several ammendments, including the eye-catching use of the particles.js, Tilt.js, and Rellax libraries.

title: The Swiss Army YouTube Searcher
blurb: A YouTube-powered app which, using Angular 1.x and the YouTube Data, Google Maps, and Yandex Translator APIs, allows the user to make fine-grain, robust video and channel searches, as well as create an account where they can save videos and specific “searches” to a Google Firebase database.

title: AptiPlex Landing Page
blurb: A landing page for a fictitious company with a simple, clean design, using jQuery, Sass, Flexbox, Velocity.js, CSS3 animations, and Fallings.js for parallax scrolling.

title: SpotiCycle
blurb: A self-motivated project using Angular 2+ and the Spotify API, allowing the user to search for artists and then cycle through related artists of infinite degrees of separation.

title: Audio Swirl
blurb: A music-based app powered by Angular 1.x as well as the TASTKiD and Spotify APIs. Users can search for an artist and then retrieve a collection of related artists, then access the artists’ Spotify pages from within the app.
